properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 6 at 3:21AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...MAJOR SNOW STORM CONTINUES THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING FOR THE
MOUNTAINS...

...SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW RETURNS TO THE INTERSTATE 80 CORRIDOR
BETWEEN RAWLINS AND PINE BLUFFS LATER TODAY THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY
MORNING...

* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of
5 to 10 inches expected, with locally higher amounts possible.
Wind gusts up to 35 MPH at times.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 Summit between Laramie and Cheyenne.

* WHEN...2 PM MST today until 5 AM MST Saturday. The worst
conditions will occur from late tonight through early Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be extremely dangerous or impossible due
to icy, snow packed roads and near very low visibilities in
falling and blowing snow.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED
